results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: Media Ecology ads
results.brief_description:
Muntadas, since the 1970s, has been preoccupied with the translation of information. In this series of three short films; Fuse, Timer and Slow Down, the artist focuses on the immediacy of the subjects
chosen for each film (a burning fuse, an hourglass, a running tap). An exploration of temporality and semiotics.

results.title: Media analysis
results.brief_description: The program looks at how to approach an analysis of written and televised media. it looks at the purpose and audience of different types of media, the way journalists use their style to create moods and the impact that the style has on the reader. Footage from news broadcasts is also shown.

results.title: Medecin Malgre Lui
results.brief_description:
Argan, a hypochondriac who coughs constantly to impress upon his family and physicians the gravity of his condition. So concerned is Argan for his health that he resolves his daughter must marry a medical student, thereby ensuring he has a doctor near him at all times.

Credits: Director, Francois Gir ; photography, Robert Juillard ; music, Dominique Paladilhe.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Darras, Rosy Varte, Claude Nicot, G. Audoubert, Herve Sand, Dora Doll, Giani Esposito.

results.title: Medea
results.creator_credit: San Marco, Number One, Janus, Franco Rossellini, Marina Cicogna and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: A mythical tale of love, betrayal and revenge, “Medea” is a fascinating collision of Freudian and Marxist themes from Italy’s most controversial director. Adapted from the Euripidean drama, Pasolini’s disturbing vision of personal and national conflict stars operatic legend Maria Callas in the title role, offering an extraordinary performance as the high priestess, Medea, whose love is threatened by corrupt political ambition. A vivid and aesthetically challenging vision, “Medea” is a complex blend of classical mythology and contemporary social criticism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: San Marco, Number One, Janus, Franco Rossellini, Marina Cicogna and Pier Pasolini

results.title: Medbourne Primary School
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center and Henry Felt
results.brief_description: Focuses mainly on the seven to eleven year-olds and the teachers in a rural school in which the total enrolment is forty-eight. Shot over a period of five days, the film shows the continual activity. Some children are painting, others are using their printing press, while others are cooking a chicken outside.

results.title: Mechanisms of non-verbal communication in the young child
results.brief_description: Looks at ways in which young children aged from eighteen months to three years communicate with each other, and shows the influence of the home and the mother on the behaviour patterns of children in relation to others.

results.title: Mechanisms of breathing
results.brief_description: The human breathing system in operation. Animated diagrams illustrated the exchange of gases in the lungs and body tissue cells, including pathological conditions. Artificial respiration is demonstrated, and the nervous control of breathing, and factors affecting the rate and depth of respiration.
